<item>
<title>Professor: Postpone Olympics to prevent Zika 'catastrophe'</title>
<guid>http://www.cnn.com/2016/05/12/health/zika-virus-professor-says-postpone-olympic-games/index.html</guid>
<link>http://rss.cnn.com/r/4e05a084ba/0L0Scnn0Bcom0C20A160C0A50C120Chealth0Czika0Evirus0Eprofessor0Esays0Epostpone0Eolympic0Egames0Cindex0Bhtml0Deref0Frss0Ihealth</link>
<description>With the Zika outbreak widening in Brazil, a leading Canadian public health professor says the Olympic games should be postponed or moved to prevent "a foreseeable global catastrophe" resulting in the deaths of adults and babies born with malformed heads.<Br><Br><a href="http://podcast.cnn.com" rel="nofollow"><img src="http://podcasts.cnn.net/cnnpodcasts/feeds/images/300-ac360.jpg"></a></description>
<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:33:55 EDT</pubDate>
<media:thumbnail height="51" width="90" url="http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/dam/assets/150506172546-biggest-stadiums-six-top-tease.jpg"/>

</item>

<item>
<title>One transgender woman's long road to finding herself</title>
<guid>http://www.cnn.com/2016/05/12/health/transgender-transition-first-person-feat/index.html</guid>
<link>http://rss.cnn.com/r/4e05a084ba/0L0Scnn0Bcom0C20A160C0A50C120Chealth0Ctransgender0Etransition0Efirst0Eperson0Efeat0Cindex0Bhtml0Deref0Frss0Ihealth</link>
<description>It was September 2015 and I was about to tell my co-workers something huge. I was filled with tremendous anxiety, as I had been before telling my sister, my dad and my kids. "Where do I start? What do I say first? What will they think it means for them?" Questions so loud in my head, I had trouble walking, focusing on sounds and things around me. </description>
<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 07:53:38 EDT</pubDate>
<media:thumbnail height="51" width="90" url="http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/dam/assets/160510180542-transgender-transition-first-person-jnd-orig-vstop-00004406-top-tease.jpg"/>

<item>
<title>Abortion rates hit historic low in developed world but not elsewhere, report says</title>
<guid>http://www.cnn.com/2016/05/12/health/abortion-incidence-rates/index.html</guid>
<link>http://rss.cnn.com/r/4e05a084ba/0L0Scnn0Bcom0C20A160C0A50C120Chealth0Cabortion0Eincidence0Erates0Cindex0Bhtml0Deref0Frss0Ihealth</link>
<description>Married women are much more likely to have them. Where they're illegal or highly restricted, it in no way stops them -- and may increase them. And though the numbers have gone down in the developed world, the figures remain largely the same in the developing world, where a vast majority of women live.</description>
<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:03:20 EDT</pubDate>

<item>
<title>Beating heroin is more than 12 steps; it's 18 years and going</title>
<guid>http://www.cnn.com/2016/04/22/health/turning-points-recovering-heroin-addiction/index.html</guid>
<link>http://rss.cnn.com/r/4e05a084ba/0L0Scnn0Bcom0C20A160C0A40C220Chealth0Cturning0Epoints0Erecovering0Eheroin0Eaddiction0Cindex0Bhtml0Deref0Frss0Ihealth</link>
<description>There is a scene in the documentary "Black Tar Heroin: The Dark End of the Street" that continues to resonate with me, despite the 18 years that have passed since 25-year-old me was featured in the film. I was asking the camera, if I wasn't using drugs, "what would I do with my life?" I was pointing to the camera, showing the soft tissue infections on my skin. I was skeletal, living in a filthy hotel room with my boyfriend. I had left my apartment a few years earlier for a spring break trip to San Francisco and had never returned home. </description>
<pubDate>Wed, 27 Apr 2016 08:00:20 EDT</pubDate>
